text: I'm the vice chancellor at Ravensbourne
University London we specialize in the
kind of cross section between technology
and creativity quite a lot of experience
particularly in the media space around
television film broadcasting editing one
of the main reasons that AWS came to our
attention was because of some of the
services that were provided around the
streaming piece of work a large part of
what we do is about educating broadcasts
and television students the project we
were mainly using these technologies for
was a project with the Royal Shakespeare
Company part of their objective is to
try and broadcast live a program to
school students around the content of
their latest Shakespeare play with the
more traditional technologies that we
were using before we had incredible
problems with satisfying all the
different schools since we've been using
AWS elemental most of those technical
issues have actually just disappeared
and we've been able to reach large
numbers of school students with higher
satisfaction so a really good example a
student presented to me some ideas that
he'd had and by using the AWS elemental
he had worked on a project in his final
year where he worked out that by using
various different approaches
with the elemental technology that he
could create a pilot television channel
for Ravensbourne University London that
could broadcast live as well as recorded
content we've talked quite a lot about
the future of Ravensbourne University
London and about how we're working with
AWS in London to bring something to
market which is very very different and
in that london education space
[Music]
